conclusion: Analyze v-t graphs to determine positions and maximum distance between cars.
Car A velocity is constant at 0 m/s from t=0 to t=10 s.
Car A velocity is constant at 40 m/s from t=10 s to t=20 s.
Car A velocity is constant at 40 m/s from t=20 s to t=30 s.
Position function for Car A from 0 to 10 s is s_A(t) = 0.
Position function for Car A from 10 to 20 s is s_A(t) = 20t - 200.
Position function for Car A from 20 to 30 s is s_A(t) = 40t - 600.
Car B velocity increases linearly from t=0 to t=20 s with slope 2 m/s².
Equation for Car B's velocity is v_B(t) = 2t.
Position function for Car B is s_B(t) = t².
Position of Car A at t=30 s is s_A(30) = -200 m.
Position of Car B at t=30 s is s_B(30) = 900 m.
Position of Car A at t=10 s is s_A(10) = 0.
Position of Car B at t=10 s is s_B(10) = 100 m.
Position of Car A at t=20 s is s_A(20) = 0 m.
Position of Car B at t=20 s is s_B(20) = 400 m.
Distance between cars at t=10 s is 100 m.
Distance between cars at t=20 s is 400 m.
Distance between cars at t=30 s is 1100 m.
Maximum distance between cars is 1100 m.
